meanings.definition: To expose in advance or beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The teacher preexposes the students to the new lesson before starting the class.
meanings.sent2: She always preexposes the audience to the main idea of her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The magician preexposes the trick to the audience, but they still can't figure it out!
meanings.sent4: His detailed explanation preexposes the complexity of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock preexposes the sleeper to the loud sound, waking them up gently.

meanings.definition: To make known or familiar with something before it happens.
meanings.sent1: The guide preexposes the hikers to the trail map before they start their journey.
meanings.sent2: The book preexposes the readers to the main characters in the first chapter.
meanings.sent3: The comedian preexposes the punchline, making the audience laugh before the joke is even told!
meanings.sent4: Her intuition preexposes the outcome of the experiment before it even begins.
meanings.sent5: The movie trailer preexposes the thrilling scenes, building anticipation among the viewers.
